reporting-org.narrative: AICS - Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development

title.narrative: NicarAGUA Qualità dell'acqua potabile e promozione della salute in Nicaragua

description.narrative: Questo progetto ha come obiettivo generale quello di contribuire a ridurre la mortalità e morbilità derivanti da malattie correlate alla qualità dell’acqua. Come raccomandato dall’OMS, la strategia d’intervento ha carattere multidisciplinare e multisettoriale ed è centrata sulla partecipazione comunitaria. Sono previste attività di igiene ambientale, con l’obiettivo specifico di migliorare la qualità e la quantità di acqua disponibile per gli abitanti del Dipartimento di León; e altre più strettamente sanitarie con l’obiettivo specifico di prevenire la malattia renale cronica e determinarne l’eziologia nei Dipartimenti di León e Chinandega.

This project has the general objective of contributing to the reduction of mortality and morbidity due to diseases related to water quality. As recommended by the WHO, the intervention strategy has a multidisciplinary and multisectoral approach and it is focused on community participation. Environmental hygiene activities are planned, with the specific objective of improving the quality and quantity of available water for the inhabitants of the Department of León; and other more health-related activities with the specific objective of preventing chronic kidney failure and determining its aetiology in the Departments of León and Chinandega.

participating-org.narrative: AICS - Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development
AICS - Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development

organisation.narrative: AICS - Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development

sector.narrative: Education and training in water supply and sanitation
Research for prevention and control of NCDs

tag.narrative: Achieve universal health coverage, including financial risk protection, access to quality essential health-care services and access to safe, effective, quality and affordable essential medicines and vaccines for all
By 2030, achieve universal and equitable access to safe and affordable drinking water for all

By 2030, expand international cooperation and capacity-building support to developing countries in water- and sanitation-related activities and programmes, including water harvesting, desalination, water efficiency, wastewater treatment, recycling and reuse technologies
By 2030, reduce by one third premature mortality from non-communicable diseases through prevention and treatment and promote mental health and well-being
Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
Support and strengthen the participation of local communities in improving water and sanitation management
